meanings.definition: To walk or move in a leisurely manner.
meanings.sent1: She was moseying along the path, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: He likes moseying through the park on lazy afternoons.
meanings.sent3: The cat was moseying around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: The river moseying through the valley, taking its time to reach the sea.
meanings.sent5: The old man's moseying pace was a familiar sight in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: We found ourselves moseying around the town with no particular destination.
meanings.sent2: The children were moseying through the woods, looking for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy was moseying down the street, sniffing at everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be moseying along, with no rush to reach the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The clouds were moseying across the sky, in no hurry to disappear.

meanings.sent1: The couple was moseying hand in hand along the beach at sunset.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was moseying into town, his spurs jingling with each step.
meanings.sent3: The robot was moseying around the room, bumping into furniture occasionally.
meanings.sent4: The music was moseying through the air, creating a relaxed atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar was moseying along the branch, in no rush to become a butterfly.
